An **athame** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed, non-stackable [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that uses the [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), and is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron").

The athame is the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") for the [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane").

## Generation

Athames are not randomly generated.

A [master lich](/wiki/Master_lich "Master lich") has an effective 6⁄91 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an athame.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) An [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich") has an effective 2⁄9 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an athame, which has a 1⁄4 chance of being [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion")-proofed and will have its enchantment raised by 1-3 points if it is below +2[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) - there is a 1⁄13 chance of calling the function for making the weapon into an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") if possible, meaning an arch-lich has a 1⁄1170 chance (less than \~0.086%) of generating with Magicbane, the only artifact that can be generated in this manner.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

[Player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [wizards](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)"), including Newt from the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest") and those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a 3⁄8 chance of forcing an athame as their initial weapon.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Description

[Engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with a non-cursed athame will not dull the weapon - an athame can engrave up to 19 letters per turn, with up to 9 letters possible in one action. As with other weapons, an athame cannot engrave if its enchantment is -3 or lower.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving")*

Athames are fairly weak as weapons despite their +2 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit"), but are exceptionally suited for engraving [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"); Magicbane is considered valuable for this as well as its curse resistance and other valuable effects. The item's rarity typically means that a mass majority of characters, especially non-[atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist") [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), will encounter Magicbane long before they ever see a regular athame - an athame found in a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file is usually one that would be Magicbane if the character that found it had *not* already obtained Magicbane themselves; it is also likely to be cursed. Be sure to mind the beatitude of *any* athame you attempt to engrave with in order to avoid being [occupied](/wiki/Occupied "Occupied") (and helpless) for more turns than intended.

## History

The athame first appears in [NetHack 3.0.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.3 "NetHack 3.0.3"). From this version to [NetHack 3.2.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.3 "NetHack 3.2.3"), Wizards start each game with a +1 athame.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) The influential [Wizard Patch](/wiki/Wizard_Patch "Wizard Patch") changes the starting weapon to the stronger-but-less-utilitarian [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), and may have been done to compensate for the Wizard's increased power from the redesigned spellcasting system, which allowed virtually unlimited casting of spells - the patch is merged completely into the mainline in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Athame](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Athame "wikipedia:Special:Search/Athame")***

An athame (or athamé) is a ceremonial blade with a generally-black handle that is the main ritual implement or magical tool among several used in ceremonial magic traditions, including neo-pagan and Satanic traditions as well as modern witchcraft. A black-handled knife called an arthame appears in certain versions of [the Key of Solomon](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_of_Solomon "wikipedia:Key of Solomon"), a grimoire dating back to the Renaissance.

The contemporary use of the athame as a ceremonial tool was started by the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn in the early 20th century, for the use of banishing rituals, and was later adopted by Wiccans, Thelemites and Satanists. The athame is also mentioned in the writings of Gerald Gardner in the 1950s, who claimed it to be the most important ritual tool of the New Forest Coven - it is speculated that his interest and expertise in antique swords and knives may have contributed to the tool's central importance in modern Wicca. Modern occultism regards the athame as one of the four elemental tools, traditionally standing for fire for witches and air for ceremonial magicians.

Contrary to popular belief, athames are not required to have double-edged blades or specially-coloured handles, though contemporary magical practitioners often choose a double-edged blade for symbolic meaning - the athame is also not used for any form of cutting or weaponry, and in fact may have blunted tips to prevent accidental wounds. Its primary function is to trace pentagrams and circles in preparation for rituals: in *NetHack*, this translates into a blade suitable for making engravings. For open rituals in public places, a ritual wand or staff is used in place of an athame, since there may be legal complications involved with public use of swords and daggers even when the edges have been dulled.

## Variants

Some variants may make the athame more common in some manner, and others introduce items and/or artifacts that are capable of engraving with the same speed and quality as an athame.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Firewall](/wiki/Firewall "Firewall") and [Deep Freeze](/wiki/Deep_Freeze "Deep Freeze") are artifact athames that act as the first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for the [Flame Mage](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage") and [Ice Mage](/wiki/Ice_Mage "Ice Mage"), respectively.

[Gnoll shamans](/wiki/Gnoll_shaman "Gnoll shaman") are always generated with athames.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) Player monster [flame mages](/wiki/Flame_mage_\(player_monster\) "Flame mage (player monster)"), [ice mages](/wiki/Ice_mage_\(player_monster\) "Ice mage (player monster)"), and [necromancers](/wiki/Necromancer_\(player_monster\) "Necromancer (player monster)") have a 3⁄8 chance of forcing an athame as their initial weapon.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

The [Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers](/wiki/Guild_of_Disgruntled_Adventurers "Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers") generates two each of player monster flame mages, ice mages, necromancers, and wizards, making it very likely that a character will find at least one athame there.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), athames deal 1d4 slashing damage to all monsters and can be [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison").

Wizards start the game with a -1 athame, which is subject to racial substitutions: [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") Wizards will start with an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger") in place of the athame, while [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") Wizards start with an elven dagger, [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race_in_dNetHack\) "Vampire (starting race in dNetHack)") Wizards start with a normal dagger, and [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") Wizards start with a [droven dagger](/wiki/Droven_dagger "Droven dagger").

[Witches](/wiki/Witch_\(dNetHack\) "Witch (dNetHack)") have a 1⁄10 chance of generating with an athame.

dNetHack has a few artifact athames:

- [Peace Keeper](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Peace_Keeper "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful [silvered](/wiki/Silver "Silver") athame that grants +1d5 to-hit and +1d10 against monsters that are [always hostile](/index.php?title=MT_HOSTILE\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "MT HOSTILE (page does not exist)") - it warns of such monsters while carried and has a 1⁄10 chance to cancel them on hit, subject to [monster magic resistance scores](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"). Peace Keeper can be twoweaponed in the offhand.
- [The Pen of the Void](/wiki/The_Pen_of_the_Void "The Pen of the Void") is an unaligned athame that acts as the first sacrifice gift and [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") of the [Binder](/wiki/Binder "Binder"), and has +1d5 to-hit with additional effects if [spirits](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") are bound into the weapon itself; it deals [double damage](/wiki/Double_damage "Double damage") after the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") is completed, and can be twoweaponed in the offhand. As The Pen is intended to be used for the [invocation](/wiki/Invocation "Invocation"), it is indestructible and resists being placed in containers like other [unique items](/wiki/Unique_items "Unique items").
- [Serpent's Tooth](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Serpent.27s_Tooth "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") athame that is always generated on [Mother Lilith](/wiki/Mother_Lilith "Mother Lilith"), and is permanently poisoned.
- [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") and [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand") can generate in athame form.

Several artifacts can be used to engrave with the quality of an athame:

- [The Rod of Lordly Might](/wiki/The_Rod_of_Lordly_Might "The Rod of Lordly Might") in [rapier](/wiki/Rapier "Rapier") form.
- [Helping Hand](/wiki/Helping_Hand "Helping Hand")
- [The Sceptre of Lolth](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Sceptre_of_Lolth "DNetHack artifacts") in [droven greatsword](/wiki/Droven_greatsword "Droven greatsword") form
- [The Rod of the Elvish Lords](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Rod_of_the_Elvish_Lords "DNetHack artifacts") in [elven broadsword](/wiki/Elven_broadsword "Elven broadsword") form
- [The Iron Spoon of Liberation](/wiki/The_Iron_Spoon_of_Liberation "The Iron Spoon of Liberation")

Athames are the most useful weapons for inscribing [wards](/wiki/Wards_\(dNethack\) "Wards (dNethack)"), as well as the seals required to bind spirits of the Void.

### TNNT (the game)

One of the achievements, Rare Loot, requires you to pick up an athame that was generated on a master or arch-lich.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the base item of Magicbane is changed from an [athame]() to a quarterstaff.

Kathryn the Ice Queen always generates with an [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion")-proofed athame that has the frost [object property](/wiki/Object_property#EvilHack "Object property").

An athame can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") and a [stiletto](/wiki/Stiletto "Stiletto").

[Shadowblade](/wiki/Shadowblade "Shadowblade") is an artifact athame that can only be created by combining [Werebane](/wiki/Werebane "Werebane") and [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") at a forge.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Acidfall](/index.php?title=Acidfall\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Acidfall (page does not exist)") and [Debugger](/index.php?title=Debugger\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Debugger (page does not exist)") are artifact athames that act as first gifts for the [Acid Mage](/wiki/Acid_Mage "Acid Mage") and [Electric Mage](/wiki/Electric_Mage "Electric Mage"), respectively.

[Sharpened pencils](/wiki/Sharpened_pencil "Sharpened pencil") are weapons that can be used to engrave without dulling them, similar to an athame.

## Encyclopedia entry

The consecrated ritual knife of a Wiccan initiate (one of  
four basic tools, together with the wand, chalice and  
pentacle). Traditionally, the athame is a double-edged,  
black-handled, cross-hilted dagger of between six and  
eighteen inches length.

An athame is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It is a one-handed, non-stackable weapon that uses the dagger skill, and is made of iron.

The athame is the base item for the artifact Magicbane.

An '''athame''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a one-handed, non-stackable [[weapon]] that uses the [[dagger]] [[skill]], and is made of [[iron]].

The athame is the [[base item]] for the [[artifact]] [[Magicbane]].

==Generation==
Athames are not randomly generated.

A [[master lich]] has an effective {{frac|6|91}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] an athame.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|728|nethack=3.6.7}} An [[arch-lich]] has an effective {{frac|2|9}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] an athame, which has a {{frac|4}} chance of being [[erosion]]-proofed and will have its enchantment raised by 1-3 points if it is below +2{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|730|nethack=3.6.7}} - there is a {{frac|13}} chance of calling the function for making the weapon into an [[artifact]] if possible, meaning an arch-lich has a {{frac|1170}} chance (less than ~0.086%) of generating with Magicbane, the only artifact that can be generated in this manner.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|732|nethack=3.6.7}}

[[Player monster]] [[Wizard (player monster)|wizards]], including Newt from the [[Wizard quest]] and those on the [[Astral Plane]], have a {{frac|3|8}} chance of forcing an athame as their initial weapon.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|188|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|245|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
[[Engraving]] with a non-cursed athame will not dull the weapon - an athame can engrave up to 19 letters per turn, with up to 9 letters possible in one action. As with other weapons, an athame cannot engrave if its enchantment is -3 or lower.

==Strategy==
{{main|Engraving}}
Athames are fairly weak as weapons despite their +2 [[to-hit]], but are exceptionally suited for engraving [[Elbereth]]; Magicbane is considered valuable for this as well as its curse resistance and other valuable effects. The item's rarity typically means that a mass majority of characters, especially non-[[atheist]] [[Wizard]]s, will encounter Magicbane long before they ever see a regular athame - an athame found in a [[bones]] file is usually one that would be Magicbane if the character that found it had ''not'' already obtained Magicbane themselves; it is also likely to be cursed. Be sure to mind the beatitude of ''any'' athame you attempt to engrave with in order to avoid being [[occupied]] (and helpless) for more turns than intended.

==History==
The athame first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.3]]. From this version to [[NetHack 3.2.3]], Wizards start each game with a +1 athame.{{refsrc|u_init.c|156|comment=no source for 3.2.3 on the wiki|version=NetHack 3.2.0}} The influential [[Wizard Patch]] changes the starting weapon to the stronger-but-less-utilitarian [[quarterstaff]], and may have been done to compensate for the Wizard's increased power from the redesigned spellcasting system, which allowed virtually unlimited casting of spells - the patch is merged completely into the mainline in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].{{refsrc|u_init.c|161|version=NetHack 3.3.0}}

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia}}
An athame (or athamé) is a ceremonial blade with a generally-black handle that is the main ritual implement or magical tool among several used in ceremonial magic traditions, including neo-pagan and Satanic traditions as well as modern witchcraft. A black-handled knife called an arthame appears in certain versions of [[Wikipedia:Key of Solomon|the Key of Solomon]], a grimoire dating back to the Renaissance.

The contemporary use of the athame as a ceremonial tool was started by the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn in the early 20th century, for the use of banishing rituals, and was later adopted by Wiccans, Thelemites and Satanists. The athame is also mentioned in the writings of Gerald Gardner in the 1950s, who claimed it to be the most important ritual tool of the New Forest Coven - it is speculated that his interest and expertise in antique swords and knives may have contributed to the tool's central importance in modern Wicca. Modern occultism regards the athame as one of the four elemental tools, traditionally standing for fire for witches and air for ceremonial magicians.

Contrary to popular belief, athames are not required to have double-edged blades or specially-coloured handles, though contemporary magical practitioners often choose a double-edged blade for symbolic meaning - the athame is also not used for any form of cutting or weaponry, and in fact may have blunted tips to prevent accidental wounds. Its primary function is to trace pentagrams and circles in preparation for rituals: in ''NetHack'', this translates into a blade suitable for making engravings. For open rituals in public places, a ritual wand or staff is used in place of an athame, since there may be legal complications involved with public use of swords and daggers even when the edges have been dulled. 

==Variants==
Some variants may make the athame more common in some manner, and others introduce items and/or artifacts that are capable of engraving with the same speed and quality as an athame.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[Firewall]] and [[Deep Freeze]] are artifact athames that act as the first [[sacrifice gift]] for the [[Flame Mage]] and [[Ice Mage]], respectively.

[[Gnoll shaman]]s are always generated with athames.{{refsrc|makemon.c|726|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} Player monster [[Flame mage (player monster)|flame mages]], [[Ice mage (player monster)|ice mages]], and [[Necromancer (player monster)|necromancers]] have a {{frac|3|8}} chance of forcing an athame as their initial weapon.{{refsrc|mplayer.c|220|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

The [[Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers]] generates two each of player monster flame mages, ice mages, necromancers, and wizards, making it very likely that a character will find at least one athame there.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], athames deal 1d4 slashing damage to all monsters and can be [[poison]]ed.

Wizards start the game with a -1 athame, which is subject to racial substitutions: [[Orc (starting race)|orcish]] Wizards will start with an [[orcish dagger]] in place of the athame, while [[Elf (starting race)|elven]] Wizards start with an elven dagger, [[Vampire (starting race in dNetHack)|vampire]] Wizards start with a normal dagger, and [[Drow (starting race)|drow]] Wizards start with a [[droven dagger]].

[[Witch (dNetHack)|Witches]] have a {{frac|10}} chance of generating with an athame.

dNetHack has a few artifact athames:

* [[dNetHack artifacts#Peace Keeper|Peace Keeper]] is a lawful [[silver]]ed athame that grants +1d5 to-hit and +1d10 against monsters that are [[MT_HOSTILE|always hostile]] - it warns of such monsters while carried and has a {{frac|10}} chance to cancel them on hit, subject to [[Magic resistance (monster)|monster magic resistance scores]]. Peace Keeper can be twoweaponed in the offhand.
* [[The Pen of the Void]] is an unaligned athame that acts as the first sacrifice gift and [[quest artifact]] of the [[Binder]], and has +1d5 to-hit with additional effects if [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirits]] are bound into the weapon itself; it deals [[double damage]] after the [[Quest]] is completed, and can be twoweaponed in the offhand. As The Pen is intended to be used for the [[invocation]], it is indestructible and resists being placed in containers like other [[unique items]].
* [[dNetHack artifacts#Serpent's Tooth|Serpent's Tooth]] is a lawful [[Intelligent artifact|intelligent]] athame that is always generated on [[Mother Lilith]], and is permanently poisoned.
* [[Fire Brand]] and [[Frost Brand]] can generate in athame form.

Several artifacts can be used to engrave with the quality of an athame:

* [[The Rod of Lordly Might]] in [[rapier]] form.
* [[Helping Hand]]
* [[dNetHack artifacts#The Sceptre of Lolth|The Sceptre of Lolth]] in [[droven greatsword]] form
* [[dNetHack artifacts#The Rod of the Elvish Lords|The Rod of the Elvish Lords]] in [[elven broadsword]] form
* [[The Iron Spoon of Liberation]]

Athames are the most useful weapons for inscribing [[Wards (dNethack)|wards]], as well as the seals required to bind spirits of the Void.

===TNNT (the game)===
One of the achievements, Rare Loot, requires you to pick up an athame that was generated on a master or arch-lich.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the base item of Magicbane is changed from an [[athame]] to a quarterstaff.

Kathryn the Ice Queen always generates with an [[erosion]]-proofed athame that has the frost [[Object property#EvilHack|object property]].

An athame can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[dagger]] and a [[stiletto]].

[[Shadowblade]] is an artifact athame that can only be created by combining [[Werebane]] and [[Stormbringer]] at a forge.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[Acidfall]] and [[Debugger]] are artifact athames that act as first gifts for the [[Acid Mage]] and [[Electric Mage]], respectively.

[[Sharpened pencil]]s are weapons that can be used to engrave without dulling them, similar to an athame.
